content:
Your task is to create a concise running summary of actions and information results in the provided text, focusing on key and potentially important information to remember.

You will receive the current summary and your latest actions. Combine them, adding relevant key information from the latest development in 1st person past tense and keeping the summary concise.

Summary So Far:
"""
I attempted multiple paths to activate the arcgis environment, but all attempts resulted in an error message indicating that certain files or directories were missing. I tried executing various commands to activate the environment, including sourcing conda.sh and activating the environment using different paths, but all attempts resulted in a "No such file or directory" error message.
"""

Latest Development:
"""
[Message(role='your computer', content="Command execute_shell returned: STDOUT:\nb''\nSTDERR:\nb'bash: line 1: /opt/miniconda3/etc/profile.d/conda.sh: No such file or directory\\n'", type='action_result'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "execute_shell", "args": {"command_line": "bash -c \'source /opt/miniconda3/etc/profile.d/conda.sh && conda activate arcgispro-py3 && python -c \\"import arcgis; print(arcgis.__version__)\\"\'"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content="Command execute_shell returned: STDOUT:\nb''\nSTDERR:\nb'bash: line 1: /opt/miniconda3/etc/profile.d/conda.sh: No such file or directory\\n'", type='action_result'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "execute_shell", "args": {"command_line": "bash -c \'source /opt/anaconda3/bin/activate && conda activate arcgispro-py3 && python -c \\"import arcgis; print(arcgis.__version__)\\"\'"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content="Command execute_shell returned: STDOUT:\nb''\nSTDERR:\nb'bash: line 1: /opt/anaconda3/bin/activate: No such file or directory\\n'", type='action_result')]
"""
